intro: Opuntia apurimacensis, commonly known as the Apurímac prickly pear, is a species of cactus native to the Andean regions of Peru. It is characterized by its flat, paddle-shaped stems covered in sharp spines and small glochids. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers during the growing season, followed by edible fruits that are typically consumed fresh or used in local culinary traditions. Opuntia apurimacensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its ecological significance includes providing food and shelter for various desert wildlife species.
